resources.string: Guainia is one of 32 departments of Colombia. It is located to the east. Formerly a curator, but since 1991 is officially a department.

It limits the north with the department of Vichada, on the east by the Atabapo, Guainía, Black rivers and border with the Republic of Venezuela, the south with the Republic of Brazil and to the west with the departments of Guaviare and Vaupés.

Following the river Inírida from the capital, after passing for the communities indigenous to Caranacoa, Huesito, The deer and backwater. They are a few immense black rocks that arise from the thickness of the jungle. The ascent does not need special equipment and can camp.

The indigenous communities are located at the foot of the great rivers, making it easy to access communities. The plan is to accompany the natives to their tasks of hunting, fishing and gathering fruit, learning to paddle their canoes, and making spears and traps.

"In the mountains of Caranacoa between the Inirida river and the border with Brazil, an area of over one million hectares of forests and savannas, with mountains and extends granite columns.\n\n The park hosts some 180 species of mammals, and several reptiles and fish. It is a very wet and warm sanctuary, in good part remains flooded several months."

"It is located on the Colombian-Venezuelan border. name given by the German scientist Alexander Humboldt Vonn, over 200 years ago. It is formed by the confluence of the Orinoco, Atabapo and Guaviare rivers. \n\nThere you can see the majesty of the river star, joining the rivers Guaviare, Orinoco and Atabapo. It shows how the color of the waters around this beautiful place are exchanged. By joining the color of the river with the color of the sky, like a sea that combined with the variety of birds that live there it makes it much more attractive. "

"Located in the village of San Felipe, on the eastern tip of Colombia, on one of the edges of the thin ledge of the country, which flows into Brazilian and Venezuelan territory. It is one of the last heritage sites to be declared of cultural interest of national character and the first to be recognized as such in the department of Guainia.\n\n The site access is by air, aircraft type DC3 about a 50-minute journey from Inírida. You can also reach waterway, making transit through Venezuelan territory in Maroa, with a route that may take about 12 hours"
